item.title: Getting Started with Java PathFinder
item.description: Java™ Pathfinder, or “JPF” as we call it from here, is a highly customizable execution environment for verification of Java™ bytecode programs. JPF was developed at the NASA Ames Research Center, open sourced in 2005, and is freely available here under the NOSA 1.3 license. JPF started as a software model checker but it integrates model checking, program analysis and testing. In this post we will go in a step by step process to setup the environment where Java Path Finder can be used within Eclipse IDE environment.
